CutSceneText.Text: Ah, here comes [%username]. I called you here because I have a very special mission for you.
Have you heard that the Orcs' attacks are becoming increasingly violent? That's what the mission is about.
Of course, the attacks by these useless Orcs do not pose a serious threat to out Tijerid Army.
But it is highly suspicious that they have been attacking weak points in the Tijerid Army of late.
Incredibly, there are rumours that they know the exact weak points of the Occupation Troop.
They are attacking only the key army facilities like supply and weapon stores.
And when we notice this and launch a counterattack they disappear. It's almost as if they knew which route we are taking.
Those troops haven't once been able to engage in combat with the Orcs.
This has to mean that somebody with in-depth knowledge of our army is connected to the Orcs.
And that same somebody must know all about clandestine troop movements.
You can speak plainly.
It is highly likely that one of the turncoats who attempted to murder the Elyos has leaked this information.
Of course, I can't know for definite until we have investigated everything.
I have therefore decided that we need someone to keep a watchful eye on the Orcs.
That person will have to infiltrate the Orcs' base and find out who is behind all this.
Sorry? What? But not...
Haha! You're looking a little pale. Please, don't look so shocked.
It doesn't matter how much we trust you, we wouldn't order you to enter a base that is teeming with Orcs.
Well, it wouldn't have been too much of a problem in my younger days. But you might find it is too much for you.
Stop mocking me and just keep talking.
I only called you because I have come up with a solution. Do you know a witch who goes by the name of Drenon Mines?
Yes, from the catapult mission.
Then let's not beat about the bush. Go and find the old dear. She will have prepared a potion that will help you to infiltrate the Orc Cave undetected.
The Captain of the Orcs is called Shandu. If you eavesdrop on the Kobold Engineers, we'll find out his location.
The glass on the tree controls the prison in the harbour. You will meet him there.
I wish you good luck, then.
What?! Yurid, that nutcase?
Did you really see them?
Yes, it was definitely them.
You must summon the Knights and the Red Flame Squad immediately and destroy them!
Mikael, you need to make a decision!
Calm down. Didn't you foresee this, but there just isn't any evidence?
Are you hanging onto your own flesh and blood, even though the situation has deteriorated so badly?!
No, it's not like that. We mustn't launch a preemptive strike unless we know what their plans are.
If that's the way you want it...
The fact that they are provoking the Elyos of their own accord means they are up to something much bigger.
Let's start by telling the commanding officers at each outpost to increase the number of scouts so they can keep an eye on the Orcs' movements at all times.
OK, I see.
Oh yeah, I'd forgotten about you. Thank you [%username]. We couldn't have found it without you.
You can claim the reward for your services from Telia outside the Audience Chamber.
Thank you very much.
